com.thindeck.api

Interface Memo

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MkMemo

    @Immutable
public interface Memo
    Memo of a Repo.

    Memo is an XML document with data about the current state of the repository. A memo can contain, for example, the list of Docker containers that are running the repo at the moment.

    Full description of what information a memo should (and can) include you can get from its XSD schema.

    Memo should not guarantee any thread-safety. It is assumed that the client calls read() and update(Iterable) methods consequently. If two threads will update in parallel, the result may be unpredictable.

    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Yegor Bugayenko (yegor@tpc2.com)

      • read

        @NotNull(message="XML can\'t be null")
com.jcabi.xml.XML read()
                       throws IOException
        Read XML.

        The method must guarantee that the XML document it returns complies to the XSD schema.

        XML

      • update

        void update(Iterable<org.xembly.Directive> dirs)
            throws IOException
        Update.

        The method must throw a runtime exception if, after applying the changes to the XML, it violates the XSD schema.

        Parameters:
        dirs - Directives
        Throws:
        IOException - If fails
